Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the number of votes that Joe Biden received on "ballots where the voter ONLY voted for President" in Georgia.
Understate: The claim understates the fact that some voters in Georgia do not vote a straight-party ballot.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it ignores the possibility that some voters selected Biden for president but didn't adhere to a strictly party-line vote for the Senate.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption that all of the votes in favor of Biden must have been on ballots for Biden only.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that the difference in votes between Biden and the Democratic Senate candidate does not necessarily mean that all those votes were on ballots for Biden only.
